Hi,

fields.description:
Please update the documentation [Connecting JIRA to PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL] to clarify that the language based collation is not Supported. For example :
LC_COLLATE = 'sv_SE.UTF-8'
LC_CTYPE = 'sv_SE.UTF-8'


Only ENCODING 'UNICODE' LC_COLLATE 'C' LC_CTYPE 'C'  would work.

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Navigate to a rapid board (Backlog or Active Sprint)
2. On an issue which in the middle of the sprint or column, try to bring up the menu by right clicking.

Actual Result:
The pop-up appears for a brief period and then disappears.

Expected Result:
The menu pop-up stays
fields.summary: Firefox - Right-clicking an issue in the Backlog does not bring up the Agile actions menu

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
JIRA allows to express dependencies between issues by adding links (by default, "depends on"/"blocks"). On the agile boards, these dependencies can only be seeen when selecting a specific issue and scrolling to the linked issues section.

As a developer choosing an issue to work on the Kanban or Scrum boards,
I would like to have these dependencies visualized on the issue cards
so that I can make a more informed choice and have a reduced risk of wasting time by choosing a "not yet workable" issue.

As a product owner ranking issues on the Kanban or Scrum boards,
I also would like to have the dependencies visualized on the issue cards
so that I don't inadvertently rank issues the wrong way around.

The concrete link types to count as "blocking" should ideally be configurable; practically, the standard "depends on" type could also suffice.

Suggestions for this visualization:
* arrows drawn between issues with dependencies,
* icon or a different (darker) card color for issues blocked by other open issues,
* a list of blocking issue numbers (with links) on the cards.
fields.summary: Visualize dependencies between issues on the agile boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our plugin (Plangle, https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.moresimp.plangle), depends heavily on JIRA Agile.

After upgrading JIRA to 6.4 our plugin stopped working because an OSGI dependency error:
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2015-03-23 09:59:37,280 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR[plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin] Detected an error (BundleException) enabling the plugin 'com.moresimp.plangle' : Unresolved constraint in bundle com.moresimp.plangle [155]: Unable to resolve 155.0: missing requirement [155.0]*package; (package=com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rank)*. This error usually occurs when your plugin imports a package from another bundle with a specific version constraint and either the bundle providing that package doesn't meet those version constraints, or there is no bundle available that provides the specified package. For more details on how to fix this, see https://developer.atlassian.com/x/mQAN

Which obviously means that the container can not satisfy our dependency to 'com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rank'...

We checked the mentioned page but could not find out what went wrong in JIRA 6.4, since this worked before the upgrade with the same JIRA Agile version.
our code snippet that imports rank service...

<component-import key="rankService" interface="com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rank.RankService" filter=""/>

Additional information... our plugin fails to start only when JIRA starts up.
It works if we re-install the plugin on a running JIRA instance.

{color:red}*After some investigation it seems that in JIRA 6.4, JIRA Agile is ALWAYS the last plugin that is loaded by Felix, no matter what dependency we specify...*{color}

*It also happens with other plugins that depend on JIRA Agile like 
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.brokenbuild.agile-reports*

Now we are blocked with our plugin development because of this error.
fields.summary: JIRA 6.4 - Plugins can not depend on JIRA Agile packages anymore

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: To be able to navigate to different boards while on scrum board. This is useful when there are more than 15 different boards. Therefore, this way it is easier for user to access links and land to desire board.
fields.summary: Links to Navigate to Different Boards in Agile

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I add additional fields to the Backlog view (e.g. "Customer Affected" custom field), any extra fields are shown on a separate line from the default fields (Issue Type, Priority, Name, Version(s), Epic, Avatar, Points). 

This makes backlog management much harder since suddenly I can fit only half as many tasks on the page.  When managing a 500-task backlog and 30-task sprints, losing half my screen real estate is frustrating, especially since my 1920px-wide monitor already has vast unused extra space in the middle of the page. 

Instead, I'd like the option for fields I add to show up on the one-line backlog "card" instead of forcing a 2-line display. 

ideally, I'd like to the backlog "card" layout to be customizable so that I could choose which columns are shown (for example, hide the priority column that we don't use) and where they should be shown. For example, placement options could include: 
* first line - left 
* first line - right
* second line - left
* second line - right

And so on. I'm sure there are other ways to define placement. But this kind of customization is definitely a lower priority than fixing the 2-line thing. The top priority is that JIRA shouldn't require me to give up half my screen real estate to show one more field in my backlog.
fields.summary: As a PM, I want to show extra fields on each backlog task without taking up 2 lines per task

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Collapse detail view (right side panel) when multiple issues selected

fields.description:
JIRA Agile: 6.6.51 on JIRA 6.3.12

Using a label to segregate issues between 2 boards based on one project.

1) Created label = 'Calypso' in 3 issues
2) Created label = 'calypso' in 3 issues
3) Set board filter = project = <project> AND labels = Calypso
4) Board correctly display 3 Calypso issues in the backlog
5) Create Epic from link in Epics Panel 
6) The Epics's label are not automatically inherited.

It would be nice if the labels are inherited when creating  Epic from link in Epics Pane.

I also tested with JIRA 6.3.15 & JIRA 6.4
fields.summary: Automatically inherit Labels on the Agile Board when creating Epic from link in Epics Panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
JIRA Agile: 6.6.51 on JIRA 6.3.12

Using a label to segregate issues between 2 boards based on one project.

1) Created label = 'Calypso' in 3 issues
2) Created label = 'calypso' in 3 issues
3) Set board filter = project = <project> AND labels = Calypso
4) Board correctly display 3 Calypso issues in the backlog
5) Create Epic from link in Epics Panel 
6 ) Manually set the labels in the Epic created
7)  Create an Issue in that Epic
7) The issue does not inherit the Label configured in the Epic

It would be nice if the labels are inherited when creating  issue in the Epic

I also tested with JIRA 6.3.15 & JIRA 6.4
fields.summary: Automatically inherit Labels on the Agile Board when creating Issue in Epic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11878].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

For specific instances there is no link to 'Backlog' or 'Active Sprints' in the new project sidebar.

h3. Workaround

Disabling JIRA Agile and Enabling it again solves this problem.

h3. Cause

This is a temporary issue caused by our deployment of plugins to our production environment.
fields.summary: Backlog and Active Sprints links are missing in JIRA Agile when using the new Project Sidebar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11877].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce :

# Create an issue and add it to a future Sprint.
# Notice that it shows up on the backlog view of the Rapid board
# Now close that issue
# Notice that it disappears from the backlog view
# Now start the Sprint
# Notice that the issue suddenly appears in the Sprint as a closed issue


This is confusing for the users.
fields.summary: Issues closed in future sprints do not show up in the Backlog until the Sprint is started

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
one of our board is having issues completing the sprint.
 
When trying to complete a sprint that has unresolved sub-tasks, instead of automatically moving these issues to the backlog it gives pop up stating:
"Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks in the following issue: ..."

The issues that it pops up are in resolved state and not actually closed/completed and have subtasks either in closed/open state.
Expected Result: it should allow us to complete the sprint and move uncompleted issues to backlog/next sprint

I tried to imitate the same scenario in our sandbox project and it allows me to complete the sprint

I went through the atlassian answers forum. not sure if it is still a bug in 6.13.1 version of agile
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/190546/can-no-longer-carryover-incomplete-stories-getting-sprint-cannot-be-completed-as-there-are-incomplete-subtasks
fields.summary: not able to complete the sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As an administrator I want to be able to tell users to make a cleanup amongs all agile boards.
The problem is that users tend to create a massive amount of boards for testing purpose and then never delete them.

I suggest that on the 'manage boards' page there is a filter to find all boards you are administrator of. This would make it very easy for users to find what boards they have created or are responsible for to make a decision if it is in use or not.
fields.summary: easy way to find which boards im administrator of

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The *Agile Wallboard gadget* will get blank and flicker when refreshing the data in the *Presentation mode*. This seems to be the expected behavior, but would be nice if the refresh process happen in a more smoothly way.
fields.summary: Avoid the flicker while refreshing data in the Agile Wallboard gadget when in Presentation mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Being able to supply a numeric parameter to indicate how many previous sprints to consider would be incredibly useful rather than having to supply a specific sprint identifier. Users could then run queries based on the last 4 sprints or whatever they're interested in which would help would quarterly reporting.

I.e. project = DEMO AND closedSprints(4) means last 4 closed sprints for this particular project. I realize this may be tricky, however, as sprints are tied to a single project.
fields.summary: Supply sprint parameters for closedSprints() function

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11863].
  {panel}

Currently Epic in Agile Backlog only list the summary of the following
* Issues
* Completed
* Unestimated
* Estimate (Original estimate)
* Progress bar

Allowing "Remaining Estimate" to be included in the summary will allow understanding of the current picture of the time that is currently in progress (vs Done in the Progress bar) to be used for planning purpose.
fields.summary: Epic Summary to show Remaining Estimate in Backlog

When adding a *Progress* field to the Card Layout on a Scrum Board (Configure / Card layout / Work mode), it's displayed not filling the card width but squeezed when using Firefox. When forcing the max-width: 100% by using width: 100% on the element, it's displayed properly.

This issue is not present when using Chrome.
fields.summary: Progress field in Card Layout is squeezed in Firefox due to ignored 'max-width' in css

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are using hosted version of JIRA/Atlassian. I am running a Kanban board. When I update the board name in the config area, it accepts the name, but when I access the board, it titles the board "Kanban Board". In other words it is not picking up the name of the board as defined in the config.

-- Sometimes the proper name is displayed while the board is loading. But then reverts to "Kanban Board" when finished.
-- When other users access the board, some see Kanban Board and others see the proper name for the board.

Thanks.
Ramesh
fields.summary: Board name is not updating

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When using Internet Explorer 11, the epic report chart is sometimes drawn where it overlaps the status report.

When viewing the epic report, refreshing browser page, the epic report is drawn where it overlaps the status report around 60-80% of the time. The chart will be incorrect for a few refreshes, then will be in the correct position, after more refreshes the chart returns to incorrect position. 
* There does not appear to be any consistent behavior or a certain number of refreshes that causes the change.
* Able to reproduce in various resolutions including 1900x1200, 1900x1080, 1600x900, and 1280x1024
fields.summary: Epic Report chart area is not drawn in correct position

fields.description:
It would be nice to rank the Epics against the other Epics - independant of the Stories that are linked to them. It is a cross-team activity before the different teams start working on their parts of the Epics. So Epics need to be ranked sometimes even before Stories exist. 

 May be the two Screenshots illustrate the problem:

nothing to select in Backlog
!RankingEpics_NewBoard_isEmpty.png|thumbnail!

I can easily set the Rank of Epics in ClassicBoard.
In both cases, the Filter filters for Epics only.
!RankingEpics_ClassicBoard.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Rank Epics againts other Epics

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA Agile, there is currently no method of limiting the type of Issues that can be included in an Epic. This could be useful when focusing on specific areas of the backlog for certain use cases. 

h3. Expected Results
When creating an Epic, have the ability to restrict the linking of specific Issue types. This could be a Checkbox dropdown in the sidebar menu when looking at the backlog.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict the type of issues that are included in an Epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Project/Board Admin for ProjectA cannot end Sprint1 (with corresponding error message about not being to be a project admin for ProjectB and ProjectC) because there are issues in ProjectB and ProjectC associated with Sprint1. However, [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Cannot+end+sprint+because+I+am+not+the+administrator+for+other+projects] suggests that the administrator should be able to end the sprint on BoardA if BoardA's filter only includes issues from ProjectA. Indeed BoardA's filter is "project = PROJECTA order by Rank ASC"

I give user's advice that they should modify the issues in other projects to be associated with a different sprint, but the KB article suggests that this user should already be able to end Sprint1 on their board.
fields.summary: Board/Project Admin Cannot End Sprint with Issues in Other Projects, Even with Filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:

Today the gadget works only with active sprints.
Documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+the+Sprint+Health+Gadget
fields.summary: Allow Sprint Health Gadget to work with all active and closed sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# install JIRA 6.2.6 and JIRA Agile 6.6.70
# access JIRA/Agile from Chrome
# create a sample Scrum/Kanban board
# access JIRA from IE8
# try navigating to the Scrum/Kanban board or Manage Boards page

h4. +Expected behavior+
Can access the boards/page normally

h4. +Actual behavior+
The browser turns blank with error:
!kanban_ie8.png|thumbnail!

{code}
Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E)
Timestamp: Sat, 14 Mar 2015 06:59:34 UTC


Message: Object doesn't support this property or method
Line: 2376
Char: 39114
Code: 0
URI: http://192.168.1.100:8626/jira626/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_US-pgi6gg-1988229788/6264/4/3ad14de64980cebc04831585a9e36094/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid,-greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,-atl.general/batch.js


Message: 'GH.tpl.board.x' is null or not an object
Line: 2017
Char: 2759
Code: 0
URI: http://192.168.1.100:8626/jira626/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_US-pgi6gg-1988229788/6264/4/3ad14de64980cebc04831585a9e36094/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid,-greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,-atl.general/batch.js
{code}

h4. +Note+
For Agile 6.6.60, only Manage Boards page is affected

h4. +Workaround+
Since Agile 6.6.51 is not affected, uninstalling 6.6.60/6.6.70 and installing 6.6.51 works:
# download JIRA Agile 6.6.51 from [here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira/versions]
# from Manage add-ons, uninstall JIRA Agile and refresh the page
# click Upload add-on and upload the downloaded file
# reindex JIRA
(!) If there's a message that "JIRA Agile is currently unavailable...", just restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Cannot access or manage Agile boards in IE8

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Users start a sprint then set the _Start Date_ and _End Date_. When they complete the sprint before it is actually ended, the _Sprint Report_ will be using the date when they click *Complete Sprint* button. It's causing some confusion for some users as they think JIRA Agile should be using the Sprint *End Date* instead of the date where the Sprint is marked as _Complete_.

By renaming the Sprint *End Date* to *Planned End Date*, I believe it would make it easier for users to understand that the _End Date_ is actually _Planned End Date_, not the actual completion (End/Completed) date for a Sprint.
fields.summary: Rename Sprint "End Date" to "Planned End Date"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to select which issues belong to a release when you click the release link on the board. 

Sometimes I forget to clear my completed items before marking new issues as completed for the next release cycle. If I could uncheck issues from the release screen I could exclude them and keep those items in the completed list for the next release.
fields.summary: Ability to select which issues belong to a release

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11849].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
{{*Error rendering 'gh-sprint'. Please contact your JIRA administrators.*}} was thrown for *Sprint* field when viewing the Field Configuration screen.

h5. Step to reproduce
# Go to *Custom Field*
# Refer to *Sprint* field
# Click on *cog* icon > *view*
# The error is thrown like in the screenshot below
!ghsprint.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Information
* It affects JIRA 6.3.10 with JIRA Agile 6.6.13 and JIRA 6.3.15 and JIRA Agile 6.6.70
* Happens in Clean installation (no changes were made) 
* I think it's related with bug [GHS-11399|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-11399], but in this case, the sprint field *was never UNLOCKED*

h3. Notes
This issue is a *JIRA UI problem* in the Field Configuration only. It indicates that JIRA cannot display the Default Value of the field, it does not affect your boards or prevent issues from being shown. Please continue using the [Troubleshooting guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Issues+are+not+appearing+in+Boards] to find the reason issues are missing.
fields.summary: Error rendering 'gh-sprint' shown for Sprint field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a quick filter has some invalid field used or tries to reference another filter the user does not have access to, the board will be empty with no error message. For example, the quick filter of {{filter = "Some Other Filter"}} will be accepted when configuring, but when viewed by another user that does not have access to "Some Other Filter", the board will be empty when the quick filter is applied.

Issue also applies to card coloring by JQL. If there is an issue, no cards will be color, but no error will be shown to make it clear there is an issue with the JQL.
fields.summary: Error message is not shown if quick filter can not be run

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{{Original summary: Dots in Kanban cards considering weekends even when they are not selected on ‘Working Days’}}

It would be interesting to have the dots in Kanban boards reflecting the configuration set on ‘Working Days’ settings.

Currently, even if users uncheck Saturday and Sunday on their boards, the amount of dots displayed on the cards disregards this setting and the total days in a column will consider a 7 days week.

_Noticed on Cloud instances: JIRA Agile v6.6.70-D20150216T131212_
fields.summary: Days in column indicator dots should respect non-working days for the board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I believe we should have a documentation to explain to customers why Story Points on sub-tasks are currently not being counted towards the Burndown Chart. The lack of pages containing this information can be reason of doubt from our customers.
fields.summary: Clarification for Burndown chart not counting Story Points on Sub tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a scrum master I would like to be able to apply boundary dates for sprints that have not yet started so that I can schedule upcoming sprints

Acceptance Criteria
* I can apply sprint start date for sprints not yet started
* I can apply sprint end date for sprints not yet started
fields.summary: As a scrum master I would like to be able to apply boundary dates for sprints that have not yet started

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Be able to create pages, Stand-up notes, etc., and have links to them on the Board for Kanban but on the Sprint for Scrum. For Scrum having it be per Sprint would even be more useful.
fields.summary: As a board manager I want to be able to create and link Conflunce pages to a Board.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11838].
  {panel}

h3. *Steps to Reproduce* 
# Created three custom fields *Text Field (Multi-line)* set the *Renderers: Wiki Style Renderer*
# Associated the custom fields to the Project 
# Open the Jira Agile Board, Click *Create (in the top Navigation Bar)*
# Fill in the custom fields *Text Field (Multi-line)* 
# Getting an error:
!error.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Observations*
# Not getting the error when the Custom Field Renderers is *Default Text Renderer*
# Not getting the error when you Create issue, by accesing the Jira Agile Board then *right click Create(in the top Navigation Bar) then Open Link in a New Tab*

h3. *Workaround*
Create issue by accessing the Jira Agile Board then *right click Create(in the top Navigation Bar) then Open Link in a New Tab*
fields.summary: Getting Script error when creating issue in Agile Board View with a Project that has more than two Text Field (multi-line) Custom Field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
# Have a board which looks at multiple projects
# Have epics from multiple projects (let's say "Project 1" and "Project 2")
# Drag an issue which is in "Project 1" to an "Project 2" epic
# You won't be allowed to change the epic
fields.summary: Unable to change epic to and epic from a different projet in board with multiple project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11835].
  {panel}

If the user opens the _board_ then clicks on _backlog_ (left menu), he will see the option _versions_. These versions can be edited, however when the user selects a new Release Date on the calendar, the field isn't updated.
Please check the following video:
- [^Date picker.mp4]

The same issue occurs while using the project's navigation sidebar.

*Workaround:* 
- Access the administration of the project
- Click on Versions
- There it's possible to edit the dates
fields.summary: Release date and start date cannot be changed on Agile Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Agile reports should adjust historical data in the reports reflecting the changes in JIRA workflow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Basic Search Support for the Epic Link field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Boards can be created by anyone in JIRA. In the case where the project associated to that board is deleted, then the board filter would have no shares. Thus, only the owner of that board can view it. What happens when the users delete the project is that the filter will be removed from the _sharepermissions_ table, thus the filter will be marked as No Shares. However, the filter is still listed in _searchrequest_ table.

There is no feature to allow admin to have access to the private-filtered boards. Not even from REST API. Not being able to enumerate all boards using the REST-API prevents the admin from cleaning up the boards automatically while this can be a must in some companies environment.

This is a very crucial ability that the admin should have. Imagine when for performance reasons, the user needs to split their big instance with 1000 projects twice into 3 instances with 400 - 400 - 200 projects. They do this by cloning the instances and deleting the projects that do not belong to the new instance. However, when the boards are deleted, then the admin will not have the access to the boards anymore. Not even for cleaning up purposes.
fields.summary: JIRA System Administrator should have ADMIN right in every board created even when filter is not shared

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Right now, when I grab an issue on an agile board, the columns I am allowed to drag it to have dotted boxes appear. If there is more than one status allowed in a particular column, several dotted boxes with the status names appear in that column. If there is only one allowed status in a column, no name/label appears in the dotted box.

I think the status name should appear in the dotted box, anyway. This makes it extra clear what status the issue would change to. This could resolve issues that might arise where the name of the column is not a good indicator of the allowed status in that column.
fields.summary: Not all columns on an Agile board list the actual states allowed to be dragged into

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a team member
I want an easy (one or two click) way to mark an issue as Blocked / At Risk / Going Back on our board
So I can quickly communicate a precise status to our team.

On our physical board we used to use a sticky to indicate a story was blocked, turn it to an angle to indicate "at risk", and turn it upside down to indicate it would not be completed.  We are currently using the Flag to indicate that one of those 3 is the case.  It would be great to be able to flag stories with more detail (different colors / type of flag, one click for a label, etc.).
fields.summary: Easy to use multi-state visual indicator for Agile Work mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Product Owner 
I would like a hotkey for the Backlog Search in Agile Plan mode
So that I can search for stories with less switching between a keyboard and mouse.
fields.summary: Hotkey for the Backlog Search in Agile Plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce* 
# Create a Test Filter, Created a Test JIRA Agile Board
# Copy the Agile Board 
#* It created a *Copy of the Board* but it uses the original filter instead of creating a copy of the filter
!Board.png|thumbnail!
# Deleting the Copy of the Board will delete the orginal filter 

*Expected Results*
If you copy a JIRA Agile Board it should create a copy of it and a copy of the associated filter. Deleting the copied filter should not delete the original filter. 

*Actual Results*
If you copy a JIRA Agile Board it's creating a copy of the board and does not copy the filter associated to the board
fields.summary: In copying Agile Board, it doesn't create a copy of the associated Filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a board user I would like to be able to quickly change the Swimlane configuration without having to go into the board configuration screens.  Just offering the more simple choices would be good, Epics, Assignee, Etc., leaving our JQL would be fine.

We like to have the Swimlanes by Stories most of the time and then use quick filters to show issues for a particular user. However it would be more useful if you could just switch to By Assignee or Epics more quickly.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to change the Swimlane type  on the board itself

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Under agile board's reports, choose "release burndown" for a release.  as shown in attached files, "soc-253" and "soc-250" are listed under sprint "DevOps Sprint 37 3/1 - 3/15 2".  however, they actually belong to sprint "Social Sharing 2/25 3/6".  

"Social Sharing 2/25 3/6" is the active sprint for my current board.  "DevOps Sprint 37 3/1 - 3/15 2" is an active sprint from a different board.
fields.summary: tickets show up under the wrong sprint in release burndown report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Provide an option to users to skip create new issue popup entirely if the board doesn't have any issue in backlog.

Currently, every users will be prompted with create issue screen whenever they try to access an Agile board without any issue in backlog. Not all users will have new issue to create.

This also affecting the new project centric navigation - browsing an Agile project will give the same popup.
fields.summary: Provide an option to users to skip create new issue popup entirely if the board doesn't have any issue in backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We use Sub-tasks & Defects (a Sub-task Issue Type) to assign work instead of assigning people to a Story which is really owned by the Team.
We organize our Agile Board Work View with Swimlanes for Epics and use the prioritization of the Epics to determine priority within the currently running Sprint.
Epics contain Stories which contain Sub-tasks & Defects which are then assigned to users.

However, during our Daily Stand Up, when we use a filter to see what work someone has the filter hides the Stories (as we intend) to which the Sub-tasks & Defects belong, but all of the Sub-tasks & Defects then show in the "Issues without Epics" Swimlane instead of the Swimlane to which their containing Story is a part.
fields.summary: Filtered Sub-tasks should not appear in "Issues without Epics" in Agile Board Work View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be useful to have a count of the number of issues in each swim lane in the Agile view.
fields.summary: Add issue count to Sprint swimlane header

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When watching or unwatching an issue in an Agile board the page reloads. This should not happen.

Occurs when using issue action in Detail View and when using dot dialog.
fields.summary: Watching an issue should not reload the Agile board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce:
Go to any agile board which the user has administrate project.
Go to any version, right click, edit name
Change the name to anything else.  Observe all the tickets in the middle panel get updated to the new name
Hit reload.

h1. Expected behavior
All the tickets are  have a lozenge that says that they are of version (altered version)

h1. Observed behavior
All the tickets are still in the (original version)

This has been independently verified by [~twong]


h1. Troubleshooting notes
(verified by [~twong]
1. Not a race condition: we waited for a while between each change.  (Theory was it could have been a lucene update thing)
2. No js errors are reported in the console at all when you do ths.
3. No errors in the atlassian-jira.log when it happens.
4. It seems to fail about 60% of the time:  Sometimes the change goes through.
5. Not a permissions error.  The user in question is in the administrate project role, and we double checked with the jira-administrator user also.
6. This seems to happen on every board.
7. This is reproducible on UAT.

JIRA Agile Plugin : 6.6.41
JDK 8u20
fields.summary: Changing the name of a version in the agile board does not always persist the change

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I want to import a png (234ko) and the system answers me "Internal error".

I cannot send you attachment cause I got the same error on your system.

I'm blocked by this issue, please fix it asap.
fields.summary: Cannot import attachment

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have an increasing number of boards created by anyone among our  7000+ users. This has a big bad impact on Jira performance. Now at 1100 boards we still are in a good position to find and remove obsolete inactive boards but we see a tendency that creating boards is getting out of hand in a near future.

We suggest that only Project Administrators should have the permission to create a board.
Also we suggest that the naming field when copying a board should be empty and not state "Copy of...". This will force the board to the proper naming.

Also I suggest that when a Project Administrator creates a new board it should be "Private" by default which would mean that it should not show for all other Project Administrators unless it is shared to a specific group/role or project (just the same way as when creating a filter).

We had the same problem with stuctures created by anyone when we installed the Structure plugin. We suggested the same permission change to ALM Works and they implemented this in the next release which was a very good solution.
fields.summary: Permission scope for creating Agile boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: First Project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Suggestion
Currently, the sprint dropdown box shows all sprints for all projects.  It would be a real improvement if these sprints in the dropdown were limited only to sprints containing issues for the current project you are creating the story for.

Alternatively, a better suggestion would be to provide configurations which can be set with the option to either show:
# Across multiple projects
# Only for single project
fields.summary: Limit sprints in sprint dropdown when creating story to only show sprints for the current project.

# Edit one of the dates (you'll notice that the actual edit won't come up)
# Reload the page (the edits made will now display correctly)

Currently the Work mode's Story swimlane setup only shows the key +  summary, but it would be useful to see the assigned Epic also. Users would have a better view on the sprint if the affected epic would be shown on the stories.
fields.summary: Epic link label visible on story in Active sprints (Work mode) when using story swimlanes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After the recent UI changes, the arrows to expand an Sprint are not clickable, depending on the scroll position.
It seems that there are other layout elements overlapping the arrows.
In the attached screenshot, the arrow is not clickable when in this position. if I scrollup (move the arrow down), then I can click it.
As you can see in the bug2.png attached, chrome developer tools identifies a div above the arrow.
fields.summary: Cannot expand Sprint after UI changes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We simply can't drag and drop / map statuses in our agile board configuration.
Doesn't matter if it's scrum or kanban board.

Background is slightly green highlighed as you can see in the screenshot "Bildschirmfoto 2015-02-27 um 13.33.10.png".

It's kinda critical to get our boards configured - we can work with boards which were configured in the past  ~ round about a year ago. But now we can't map statuses in old boards just as in the new ones. 

I'd appreciate an answer of yours :) 

Thanks for any advice.
fields.summary: Status drag and drop / mapping doesn't work in boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Found when a new Kanban Board is created, a sub-filter of {{fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY}} is added to the Kanban Board configuration.  This sub-filter may not be needed in some scenarios.  

This causes Issues to not display on the Kanban board if the Issues are not configured with a _fixVersion_ field. 

Customers should be able to add in their own sub-filters (if necessary) to their Kanban boards. 

*Workaround*
Remove filter
fields.summary: No Sub-Filter on New Kanban Board Creation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In previous versions of JIRA Agile, projects were created based on the Default screen scheme, as the image below:
!Screen Shot 2015-02-26 at 6.22.05 PM.png|thumbnail!

As of now, JIRA Agile creates separate schemes for each project and a different scheme for the bug issue type, this new screens do not possess the Time Tracking field also, which prevents customers from adding values on the issue creation.
!Screen Shot 2015-02-26 at 6.22.19 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to add time tracking fields to new Agile projects by default

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Agile Boards can now be configured to display custom fields as well as other system fields via the Board Configuration.

However Development panel information can not be added yet. This can only be seen in the Detail view.
fields.summary: Add Ability to add Development panel information to Card View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This bug renders the Scrum Planning View useless if the board is based on JQL filter that filters out certain issueTypes.

*How to reproduce*

# Create a new saved filter:  project = <your project> and (NOT (issuetype = Task)) ORDER BY Rank ASC
# Create a new scrum board based on this filter
# Go to that scrum board planning screen
# Create a new issue by using in-line creation field at the bottom of the issues list
# Expected: you can choose between ALL issue types (maybe except the Tasks, as they are filtered out from the board)
# Actual: you can create ONLY Tasks


*Workaround:*
Change the filter to *project = <your project> and issuetype != Task ORDER BY Rank ASC*
fields.summary: Impossible to use Scrum Board planning view to create issues if the board is based on JQL filter that excludes any issue types

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
So in a kanban view, I generally comment on tickets since im working on several at once. However before the last agile upgrade (as of today its the latest version), the comment button would work for a little while then after a couple of hours, clicking the button would open up "create issue" screen. Refreshing the page would fix it for another 2 or so hours.

With the latest agile plugin, its now create plugin all the time. This affects firefox (v35), chromium and just checked on another machine, chrome.
fields.summary: comment button in kanban view opens "create issue"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Create issue auto-popup in Agile Backlog can't be closed properly, blocking the usage.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create 2 projects with JIRA Default Schemes template
# Create 1 issue in each projects
# Close the issues
# Create Scrum Board for existing projects and select the 2 projects
# Go to the scrum board *Backlog*
# The board will prompt user to create new issue
# Click on Cancel and the board will stay greyed out

h4. Workaround
Press *Esc* button on keyboard and that should get rid of the problem.
fields.summary: Create issue auto-popup in Agile Backlog can't be closed properly, blocking the usage

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In earlier "classic" charts, you were able to see both the burndown of hours and the increase in business value in a single chart.
To achieve a similar functionality nowadays you have to create *two* agile boards with the same filter, one set to track in hours and one in business value, then put the resulting burndown gadgets side by side in a dashboard. Whew! This is still far from the simpleness of what we had before.

If the new burndown chart could superimpose the burndown of hours and the increase in either business value or story points (as bar a bar chart perhaps?) we would have a very elegant view of the overall progress.

Competitors do that already and people switching to JIRA Agile are dissapointed by the burndown chart as a result.
fields.summary: Combine Estimation Statistic and Time Tracking on the burndown chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Replication
# Login as a user without Bulk Change permissions on Global Permissions in JIRA
# Go to Agile board
# Select a few issues.
# Right-click and select Bulk Change
# Select Edit Issues, click Next.
# Scroll down to Change Labels and enter "test" label.
# Scroll to bottom, un-check Send mail for this update, and click Next.
# Confirm change.
# Receive 404 error.

h4. Expected Behaviour
# Bulk Change should not be visible to the user if they do not have permissions
# Otherwise, error should at least say they don't have permission rather than just a 404.

h4. Work around
Perform a search in the issue navigator for those issues and perform a bulk change
fields.summary: Bulk change in Agile without permissions produces 404 error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
# Click *Start Sprint*-Button -> End Date for March is suggested as dd/*Mär*/yy
# Click *Calendar Icon* to change date -> End Date for March is changed to dd/*Mrz*/yy
# Click *Start*-Button -> Sprint cannot be started, error message is shown that the date format is incorrect

The Sprint can indeed be started when the format is manually overwritten with *Mär*.
fields.summary: German Date for March changes from Mär to Mrz in Start Sprint Caledar when changed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When in the "Backlog" view of the Agile board, trying to edit the name of the epic/version doesn't work.

The change seems to take, but when I refresh the page, the updated name is not saved.
fields.summary: On the Scrum Board "Backlog" view, in-line editing of Version/Epic names doesn't work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Reorganizing Cards on Boards Removes Epic Label

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The agile board (backlog) states "This is a sprint. Plan a sprint by dragging issues here." on empty sprint (see the attachment).
I can't help to notice that the "This is a sprint." part is utterly unneccessary and is even a little amusing.
fields.summary: Agile board empty scrum sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have a dashboard that uses the Agile Sprint Health Gadget, which shows our story points grouped by todo/in progress/complete status. The chart is accurate, but when we click on a status (eg, in progress), we are taken to a page that contains an empty list of stories (see attachments).

If it helps to reproduce, this can be reproduced using the eBusiness Team Dashboard at xpedxit.atlassian.net.
fields.summary: Dashboard gadget link to in list of stories does not work

    GH.RapidBoard.init@http://localhost:8080/s/546b9de98d3aa1c9e2680901d4dc3ffe-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/2691cb375cef6d15bf0df651cee1eb4b/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-US&jag_disabled_marketing=true:2496:3099
    d.Callbacks/j@http://localhost:8080/s/85c680c989d438ccdb6dc754a6595184-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/3/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:40:215
    d.Callbacks/o.fireWith@http://localhost:8080/s/85c680c989d438ccdb6dc754a6595184-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/3/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:42:6
    .ready@http://localhost:8080/s/85c680c989d438ccdb6dc754a6595184-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/3/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:30:43
    P@http://localhost:8080/s/85c680c989d438ccdb6dc754a6595184-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/3/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:39:184{noformat}

(i) This is reproducible on a fresh installation of JIRA EAP v6.4m14 with JIRA Agile v6.6.60.

*Workaround*

Please disable the Sidebar Dark Feature by:
# Navigating to JIRA with this address http://YOUR.JIRA.COM/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
# Disable this Dark Feature {{com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation}}

If the problem remains after removing the dark feature, some users may have opted to use the new Navigation mode through a banner suggestion, so we'll need to remove their opt-in directly from the database with the following steps:
# (!) Create a backup of JIRA's database or an XML Backup from JIRA
# Shutdown JIRA
# Run the following query in JIRA's database:
{code:sql}DELETE FROM feature WHERE FEATURE_NAME like '%ProjectCentricNavigation%';{code}
# Start JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA.API.Sidebar.getAUISidebar is not a function loading Agile boards with sidebar enabled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Whenever we come across a previously unknown bug that holds up a user story, we pop a bright pink sticky note on our scrum board. Currently I enter this as a new sub-task in JIRA with "BUG: " as the first few characters of the summary. It  would be extremely useful to have a separate type of sub-task that identifies this as being a problem instead of just a sub-task with a different summary.

Unless I've missed something, I don't believe that this functionality is currently available.

Many thanks.
fields.summary: Bugs as sub-tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Today I make one Kanban Board to see all projects in our organization using JQL queries in the swimlanes - this is manual and needs frequent updates. Unfortunately it doesn't scale. I work in an organization with 5,000 employees (500 teams) and am looking for a single automated view where each week I don't have to tweak swim lanes. 

Examples:
Swimlane 1: project = ABC
Swimlane 2: project = XYZ
Swimlane 3: project = 123
etc

In addition it would be great to say all projects (grouped in swim lanes) where issues match certain criteria (eg a label called "efficiency") so I can get a view, across all teams, grouped by team, of the issues across the company working to improve efficiency.

More at (along with other customers requesting):
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/223061/answers/4050221/comments/12281173

Many thanks!
fields.summary: Group issues in JIRA Agile swimlanes automatically (no manual JQL updates continually)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Changing Focus of Field Displays Error in JIRA Agile

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I've added the Acceptance Criteria field to issues on one of my projects (UComm News). I viewed the Backlog of that project and selected an issue. Acceptance Criteria did not appear in the quick view on the right. I clicked the '...' button at the top of the panel and selected 'More actions...'. I scrolled to the bottom of the dropdown listing the available actions and selected 'Add field...'. I got the following (404) error:

Not Found
The requested URL /secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa&returnUrl=/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=25&projectKey=UCNEWS&view=planning&selectedIssue=UCNEWS-1 was not found on this server.
Apache/2.2.3 (CentOS) Server at stanfordits.atlassian.net Port 80
fields.summary: Can't add field to quick view - get 404 / Requested URL Not Found

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to [GHS-6072|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6072], the current behaviour for JIRA Agile enabled projects is for sub-tasks to inherit the parent issue Fix Version - This is currently not documented anywhere.

I believe we could update the [Adding an Issue to a Version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Adding+an+Issue+to+a+Version] document to include this observation.
fields.summary: We should update our documentation regarding versions and sub-tasks
